participating-org.narrative:
Uganda Christian Lawyers’ Fraternity is an association of Christian legal professionals which was started in 1987 as a fellowship of Christian law students and was registered as NGO in 2005, and has since grown to about 500 members who are working in allfacets ofthe Justice, Law and Order Sector. Our vision is a world where justice and human dignity is a reality for all and our mission is to share our faith in Christ Jesus, promote access to justice and the respect for human dignity, through speaking up, fellowship, mentorship and defending the rights of the vulnerable.
UCLF runs established Legal Aid Clinics and offices spread across the Northern,Western and Central regions of Uganda with a presence in Kampala, Kayunga, Kasese, Gulu, Masaka, Buikwe and Moyo Districts.
UCLF uses a rights-based approach in order to address the underlying causes of injustices, including patriarchy, poverty and social exclusion. We have an established track record in the delivery of civil legal aid, criminal defence, paralegal advisory services, community legal education and policy advocacy.
UCLF is committed to significant change in the lives of women, girls, boys, and men and recognizes the distinction between genders of all ages in the areas of operation. UCLF strives to mainstream gender equality throughout all programs and across all departments to ensure that the different needs of women, girls, boys, and men are met. The organization takes a pro-active approach to promote gender equality as an essential step in the protection of women, girls’, boys’ and men’s basic human rights. UCLF's gender policy incorporates approaches to mainstream gender equality through all programs to ensure the needs of male and female beneficiaries are met. The direct result ofthese activities is that community members, particularly women, have increased ability to identify, assess and address root causes of conflicts, and gender-based violence in their communities while the longer-term impact is to contribute to the promotionof gender equality and empowerment of women and girls. UCLF ensures that not only will there be equitable participation of both men and women, but that both can be equitably involved in design, monitoring and evaluation.
Women make up the biggest number of the Staff and the Board of UCLF. UCLF’s current Board is comprises of 5 women against 2 men. The staff are 13 women against 10 men.
UCLF has undergone all stages of Organisational development as explained bellow In the recent three years UCLF implemented the Paralegal Advisory Services, free legal representation, Alternative Dispute Resolution, Environmental Justice program, community legal rights awareness and offering psycho social counselling programs, where there were 22,210 direct beneficiaries and 720,000 indirect beneficiaries in 2017//2018, and 17,384 direct beneficiaries and 2,062,000 indirect beneficiaries in 2019/2020. Most of the beneficiaries were women and children or juveniles.
Institutional Purpose Vision: A world where justice and human dignity is reality for all.
Mission: We are an association of Christian legal professionals sharing our faith in Christ, promoting access to justice and respect for human dignity through speaking up, fellowship, mentorship and defending the rights if the vulnerable.
Core values We are committed to upholding the Christian faith and its principles of: christian ethics and integrity, justice, equity, compassion, peaceful resolution of conflicts, good governance, fellowship, professionalism, volunteerism, diversity and respect of different cultures.
Principle objectives • To inform and educate people (especially those who have no access to legal information), about the law and their rights. • To advocate for, represent and advice, those who have no voice and unfairly disadvantaged. • To advocate for the enhancement and implementation of fair laws and policies which are in harmony with Christian principles. • To encourage member participation in ethical legal practices and communityinvolvement by providing probono opportunities.
Strategic Positioning; UCLF has an established secretariat and regional offices that offer conducive facilities to staff inthe performance of their Work.
UCLF is the only organization in Uganda thatbrings together lawyers and judicial officers, most of whom hold key positions of leadership that will be capitalized on in implementing this project.
UCLF has active formal partnershipswith key Justice Law and Order Sectors (JLOS Uganda), the District Local Governments (DLGs), the Ministry of Gender, Labor and Social Development, a long spanning working relationship with the Uganda Prisons Services, the Office of the Prime Minister, the Uganda Police Force, the Ministry of Gender, Labour and Social Development, and the Judiciary.
In respect to this project, the above institutions will be contacted where there is need for resource persons to train from the said institutions, the Police will also be relevant in partnering with UCLF in community policing within refugee camps and host communities. UCLF will also engage the Office of the Prime Minister during sensitizations in the gaps and they be consulted where any relevant information is required within the camps.
Additionally, it is accredited by the Uganda Law Council as a legal aid service provider in Uganda.
